scenes.text: Before diving into Docker, you must install it on your system. Docker provides versions for different operating systems such as Windows, macOS, and Linux. Each platform has specific installation requirements and steps, but initially, you need to ensure your system meets Dockerâ€™s prerequisites like hardware requirements and necessary system configurations.
scenes.image_prompt:
# Docker Installation Overview

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[Check System Requirements] --> B[Download Docker Installer]
    B --> C[Run Installer]
    C --> D[Configure Docker]
    D --> E[Start Docker]
```

### Installation Steps:

| Step | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Check | Ensure your system meets requirements |
| Download | Obtain the Docker installer |
| Run | Execute the installation process |
| Configure | Set up docker settings if needed |
| Start | Launch Docker to verify installation |

scenes.text: After installation, you need to verify if Docker is working correctly on your machine. This involves running some basic Docker commands such as `docker --version` to check the installed version, `docker info` for system-wide information, and `docker run hello-world` to run a test container. These commands help ascertain that Docker is properly set up and responsive.
scenes.image_prompt:
# Verifying Docker Installation

```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant User
    participant Docker
    User->>Docker: docker --version
    Docker-->>User: Display version info
    User->>Docker: docker info
    Docker-->>User: Show system-wide information
    User->>Docker: docker run hello-world
    Docker-->>User: Output a Hello World message
```

### Verification Commands:

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `docker --version` | Check installed Docker version |
| `docker info` | Display Docker system information |
| `docker run hello-world` | Run a test container to ensure Docker runs correctly |

scenes.text: Configuring your Docker environment can be done using Docker Desktop or through command line configurations. Key tasks include setting up a proper Docker network, creating volumes for data persistence, and handling images and containers. Understanding how to manipulate these resources through Docker CLI commands reinforces a practical understanding necessary for managing Docker environments effectively.
scenes.image_prompt:
# Docker Environment Configuration

```mermaid
flowchart BT
    A[Configure Network] --> B[Create Volumes]
    B --> C[Manage Images]
    C --> D[Run Containers]
```

### Configuration Tasks:

| Task | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| Configure Network | Set up a network for containers |
| Create Volumes | Enable data persistence |
| Manage Images | Organize container images |
| Run Containers | Execute applications in isolated environments |
